tn.text: This is the name of a man. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:31:01|31:1-2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: two and a half cubits ... one cubit and a half
tn.text: "2.5 cubits ... 1.5 cubits" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])
These four pieces of wood that supported the ark are spoken of as if they were human or animal feet. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Bezalel's work crew continues to build the tabernacle and furniture.

tn.ref: He made ... and a half cubits
tn.text: For 37:4-6 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:12|25:13-14]] and [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:15|25:17]].
Though "he" refers to Bezalel, "he" may include all of the workers who assisted him.

tn.ref: two and a half cubits ... one and a half cubits
tn.text: "2.5 cubits ... 1.5 cubits" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])
Bezalel's work crew continues to build the tabernacle and furniture.

tn.ref: Bezalel made ... the center of the atonement lid
tn.text: For 37:7-9 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:15|25:18]] and [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:19|25:19-20]].

tn.ref: They were made as one piece
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "He made them as one piece" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The cherubim spread out their wings upward and overshadowed
tn.text: Bezalel placed the statues of the cherubim as if they were real cherubim which were spreading their wings and overshadowing the atonement lid. AT: "They placed the winged creatures so that their wings touched each other and spread out over" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: The cherubim faced one another and looked toward
tn.text: Bezalel placed the statues of the cherubim as if they were real cherubim which were facing each other and looking toward the atonement lid. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Bezalel's work crew continues to build the tabernacle and furniture.
For 37:10-13 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:23|25:23-24]] and [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:25|25:25-26]].

tn.ref: two cubits ... one cubit ... one and a half cubits
tn.text: "2 cubits ... 1 cubit ... 1.5 cubits" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])
This was the width of a man's hand with fingers spread out. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
These four pieces of wood that supported the ark are spoken of as if they were human or animal feet. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Bezalel's work crew continues to build the tabernacle and furniture

tn.ref: The rings ... out of pure gold
tn.text: For 37:14 - 16 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:25|25:27]] and [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:28|25:28-29]].
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Bezalel attached the rings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: dishes, spoons, the bowls, and pitchers to be used to pour out the offerings
tn.text: It is only the bowls and pitchers that are used to pour out the offerings. AT: "plates and cups, and also the jars and bowls which the priests will use for pouring out the offerings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Bezalel's work crew continues to build the tabernacle and furniture.

tn.ref: Its cups, its leafy bases, and its flowers were all made of one piece with it
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "He made the cups, its leafy bases, and its flowers as one piece with the lampstand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: and three cups made like almond blossoms
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and he made the 3 cups look like almond blossoms" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
An almond blossom is a white or pink flower with five petals that grows on an almond tree.

tn.ref: On the lampstand ... of pure gold
tn.text: For 37:20-22 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:33|25:34]] and [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:35|25:35-36]].

tn.ref: there were four cups made like almond blossoms
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "there were 4 cups which Bezalel made to look like almond blossoms" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: made as one piece with it
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which he made as one piece with the lampstand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Bezalel's work crew continues to build the tabernacle and furniture.

tn.ref: Bezalel made ... talent of pure gold
tn.text: For 37:23-24 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:25:37|25:37-39]].
This is a tool made from two sticks of wood or metal connected at one end and used for picking up objects.
"34 kilograms" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])

tn.ref: Its horns were made as one piece with it
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "He made the horns as one piece with the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Bezalel's work crew continues to build the tabernacle and furniture.

tn.ref: He made two golden rings ... with gold
tn.text: For 37:27-28 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:03|30:4]] and [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:05|30:5]]
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which they attached to the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
